Current Phone Number: 303-555-6677
 
Age:  56
Sex:  FEMALE
 
VITAL SIGNS:
            B/P:  141/91 (07/09/2013 11:11)
          Pulse:  99 (07/09/2013 11:11)
    Temperature:  101 F [38.3 C] (07/09/2013 11:11)
   Respirations:  20 (07/09/2013 11:11)
         Weight:  231 lb [105.0 kg] (07/03/2013 15:13)
         Height:  64 in [162.6 cm] (11/20/2012 16:31)
            BMI:  40
           Pain:  10 (07/09/2013 11:11)
 
MEDICATIONS:
Active Inpatient and Outpatient Medications (including Supplies):
 
     Outpatient Medications                                 Status
=========================================================================
1)   ASPIRIN 81MG EC TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
2)   CALCIUM CARBONATE 1.25GM (CA 500MG) TAB TAKE 500 MG    ACTIVE
       BY MOUTH THREE TIMES A DAY
3)   CHLORTHALIDONE 25MG TAB TAKE 12.5 MG  BY MOUTH EVERY   ACTIVE
       DAY
4)   ERGOCALCIFEROL 1000 UNIT CAP TAKE 1000 UNITS BY MOUTH  ACTIVE
       EVERY DAY
5)   GLYBURIDE 2.5MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
6)   LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) 0.125MG TAB TAKE ONE      ACTIVE
       TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY
7)   LISINOPRIL 20MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
8)   SIMVASTATIN 80MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY    ACTIVE
       EVENING
9)   VENLAFAXINE HCL 75MG SA CAP TAKE THREE CAPSULES BY     ACTIVE
       MOUTH DAILY
 
 
9 Total Medications
 
ALLERGIES/ADRS:
METFORMIN, CITALOPRAM, FLUOXETINE
 
  Did the patient take own medications this AM? No
 
On arrival the patient was: Ambulatory
 
Allergies are listed in CPRS as: METFORMIN, CITALOPRAM, FLUOXETINE
 
When asked about allergic reactions, patient reports: no new allergies
 
 
Mentation:  Alert and oriented to person, place, and time
 
Mental Health: 
   History of emotional/behavioral difficulties? None/Patient denies. 
   Suicide Risk Screening:
     1. In the past 2 weeks, have you been feeling down, depressed, or 
        hopeless?  no 
     2. During that time, have you had thoughts of hurting yourself in 
        some way?  no 
     3. In the past 2 weeks, have you had thoughts of killing yourself, 
        or planning your own death?  no 
   Elopement risk factors present? none
 
Homeless: No 
 
Is Visit due to injury: No 
 
Triage:
56 yo female presents to ER with chest pain. hx of HTN, DM.  Patient taken to 
bed 2 via wheel chair. Md at bedside, O2 @ 6 L/min via NC, PIV started, labs 
drawn and 12 lead EKG completed, report to ER nurse taking over.
 
Triage Level: ESI 1
text.author: NURSE,SEVENTEEN
